body:
> The downsides of version-based:
> 1) Didn't OSG patch in this tool for a given version - but UW did not? Hence, condor_version may not be a reliable indicator.

Not sure about that – I will have to check with Tim T., probably.

> 2) We've at least seen one site where two versions of HTCondor were in $PATH; that means parsing "condor_version" would also be unreliable.

Well, if we invoke “condor_version” with no path component and then we invoke condor_ce_\* also with no path component, wouldn’t both executables come from the same HTCondor directory, even if more than one HTCondor was in $PATH? (Assuming that we picked the right condor_ce_\* name based on the version, of course.) I guess I can’t quite see where the unreliability would come from, but I am probably missing something.

— Tim=
